member.summary: Implements the STOMP protocol.

member.summary: Represents the marshalling of commands to and from an IO stream

member.summary: Marshalls the given command object onto the stream

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.IWireFormat.Unmarshal(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: Unmarshalls the next command object from the stream

member.name: T:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Protocol.XmlPrimitiveMapMarshaler
member.summary: Reads / Writes an IPrimitveMap as XML compatible with XStream.

member.name: T:Apache.NMS.Stomp.State.ConnectionStateTracker
member.summary: Tracks the state of a connection so a newly established transport can be re-initialized to the state that was tracked.

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Stomp.State.ConnectionStateTracker.track(Apache.NMS.Stomp.Commands.Command)
member.returns: null if the command is not state tracked.

member.name: T:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Threads.CompositeTask
member.summary: A Composite task is one of N tasks that can be managed by a CompositTaskRunner instance. The CompositeTaskRunner checks each task when its wakeup method is called to determine if the Task has any work it needs to complete, if no tasks have any pending work then the CompositeTaskRunner can return to its sleep state until the next time its wakeup method is called or it is shut down.

member.name: T:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Threads.Task
member.summary: Represents a task that may take a few iterations to complete.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Threads.CompositeTask.IsPending
member.summary: Indicates if this Task has any pending work.

member.name: T:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Threads.CompositeTaskRunner
member.summary: A TaskRunner that dedicates a single thread to running a single Task.

member.name: T:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Threads.TaskRunner
member.summary: Allows you to request a thread execute the associated Task.

member.name: T:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Threads.DedicatedTaskRunner
member.summary: A TaskRunner that dedicates a single thread to running a single Task.

member.name: T:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Threads.ThreadPoolExecutor
member.summary: This class provides a wrapper around the ThreadPool mechanism in .NET to allow for serial execution of jobs in the ThreadPool and provide a means of shutting down the execution of jobs in a deterministic way.

member.name: T:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Threads.ThreadPoolExecutor.Future
member.summary: Represents an asynchronous task that is executed on the ThreadPool at some point in the future.

member.name: T:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.Failover.FailoverTransport
member.summary: A Transport that is made reliable by being able to fail over to another transport when a transport failure is detected.

member.name: T:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.ITransport
member.summary: Represents the logical networking transport layer. Transports implment the low level protocol specific portion of the Communication between the Client and a Broker such as TCP, UDP, etc. Transports make use of WireFormat objects to handle translateing the cononical OpenWire Commands used in this client into binary wire level packets that can be sent to the Broker or Service that the Transport connects to.

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.ITransport.Oneway(Apache.NMS.Stomp.Commands.Command)
member.summary: Sends a Command object on the Wire but does not wait for any response from the receiver before returning.

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.ITransport.AsyncRequest(Apache.NMS.Stomp.Commands.Command)
member.summary: Sends a Command object which requires a response from the Broker but does not wait for the response, instead a FutureResponse object is returned that the caller can use to wait on the Broker's response.

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.ITransport.Request(Apache.NMS.Stomp.Commands.Command)
member.summary: Sends a Command to the Broker and waits for a Response to that Command before returning, this version waits indefinitely for a response.

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.ITransport.Request(Apache.NMS.Stomp.Commands.Command,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sends a Command to the Broker and waits for the given TimeSpan to expire for a response before returning.

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.ITransport.Narrow(System.Type)
member.summary: Allows a caller to find a specific type of Transport in the Chain of Transports that is created. This allows a caller to find a specific object in the Transport chain and set or get properties on that specific instance. If the requested type isn't in the chain than Null is returned.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.ITransport.IsDisposed
member.value: Indicates if this Transport has already been disposed and can no longer be used.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.ITransport.IsFaultTolerant
member.value: Indicates if this Transport is Fault Tolerant or not. A fault Tolerant Transport handles low level connection errors internally allowing a client to remain unaware of wire level disconnection and reconnection details.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.ITransport.IsConnected
member.value: Indiciates if the Transport is current Connected to is assigned URI.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.ITransport.RemoteAddress
member.value: The Remote Address that this transport is currently connected to.

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.Failover.FailoverTransport.IsShutdownCommand(Apache.NMS.Stomp.Commands.Command)
member.returns: Returns true if the command is one sent when a connection is being closed.

member.name: T:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.Tcp.TcpTransport
member.summary: An implementation of ITransport that uses sockets to communicate with the broker

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.Tcp.TcpTransport.Start
member.summary: Method Start

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.Tcp.TcpTransport.IsStarted
member.summary: Property IsStarted

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.Tcp.SslTransport.ServerName
member.summary: Indicates the name of the Server's Certificate. By default the Host name of the remote server is used, however if this doesn't match the name of the Server's certificate then this option can be set to override the default.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.Tcp.SslTransport.ClientCertFilename
member.summary: Indicates the location of the Client Certificate to use when the Broker is configured for Client Auth (not common). The SslTransport will supply this certificate to the SslStream via the SelectLocalCertificate method.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.Tcp.SslTransport.ClientCertPassword
member.summary: Password for the Client Certificate specified via configuration.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.Tcp.SslTransport.AcceptInvalidBrokerCert
member.summary: Indicates if the SslTransport should ignore any errors in the supplied Broker certificate and connect anyway, this is useful in testing with a default AMQ broker certificate that is self signed.

member.name: F:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.Tcp.TcpTransportFactory.useInactivityMonitor
member.summary: Should the Inactivity Monitor be enabled on this Transport.

member.name: F:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.Tcp.TcpTransportFactory.receiveBufferSize
member.summary: Size in bytes of the receive buffer.

member.name: F:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.Tcp.TcpTransportFactory.sendBufferSize
member.summary: Size in bytes of send buffer.

member.name: F:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.Tcp.TcpTransportFactory.receiveTimeout
member.summary: The time-out value, in milliseconds. The default value is 0, which indicates an infinite time-out period. Specifying -1 also indicates an infinite time-out period.

member.name: F:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.Tcp.TcpTransportFactory.sendTimeout
member.summary: The time-out value, in milliseconds. If you set the property with a value between 1 and 499, the value will be changed to 500. The default value is 0, which indicates an infinite time-out period. Specifying -1 also indicates an infinite time-out period.

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.Tcp.TcpTransportFactory.DoCreateTransport(System.Uri,System.Net.Sockets.Socket,Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.IWireFormat)
member.summary: Override in a subclass to create the specific type of transport that is being implemented.

member.name: T:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.FutureResponse
member.summary: Handles asynchronous responses

member.name: T:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Transport.InactivityMonitor
member.summary: This class make sure that the connection is still alive, by monitoring the reception of commands from the peer of the transport.

member.summary: Represents a connection with a message broker

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Connection.Start
member.summary: Starts asynchronous message delivery of incoming messages for this connection. Synchronous delivery is unaffected.

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Connection.Stop
member.summary: Temporarily stop asynchronous delivery of inbound messages for this connection. The sending of outbound messages is unaffected.

member.summary: Creates a new session to work on this connection

member.summary: Creates a new session to work on this connection

member.summary: Performs a synchronous request-response with the broker

member.summary: Handle incoming commands

member.summary: Creates a new temporary destination name

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Connection.CreateLocalTransactionId
member.summary: Creates a new local transaction ID

member.name: E:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Connection.ExceptionListener
member.summary: A delegate that can receive transport level exceptions.

member.name: E:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Connection.ConnectionInterruptedListener
member.summary: An asynchronous listener that is notified when a Fault tolerant connection has been interrupted.

member.name: E:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Connection.ConnectionResumedListener
member.summary: An asynchronous listener that is notified when a Fault tolerant connection has been resumed.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Connection.AsyncSend
member.summary: This property indicates whether or not async send is enabled.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Connection.AckMode
member.summary: This property sets the acknowledgment mode for the connection. The URI parameter connection.ackmode can be set to a string value that maps to the enumeration value.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Connection.AlwaysSyncSend
member.summary: This property forces all messages that are sent to be sent synchronously overriding any usage of the AsyncSend flag. This can reduce performance in some cases since the only messages we normally send synchronously are Persistent messages not sent in a transaction. This options guarantees that no send will return until the broker has acknowledge receipt of the message

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Connection.CopyMessageOnSend
member.summary: This property indicates whether Message's should be copied before being sent via one of the Connection's send methods. Copying the Message object allows the user to resuse the Object over for another send. If the message isn't copied performance can improve but the user must not reuse the Object as it may not have been sent before they reset its payload.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Connection.SendAcksAsync
member.summary: This property indicates whether or not async sends are used for message acknowledgement messages. Sending Acks async can improve performance but may decrease reliability.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Connection.DispatchAsync
member.summary: synchronously or asynchronously by the broker. Set to false for a slow consumer and true for a fast consumer.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Connection.Transformation
member.summary: Sets the default Transformation attribute applied to Consumers. If a consumer is to receive Map messages from the Broker then the user should set the "jms-map-xml" transformation on the consumer so that all MapMessages are sent as XML.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Connection.DefaultClientId
member.summary: The Default Client Id used if the ClientId property is not set explicity.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Connection.RedeliveryPolicy
member.summary: Get/or set the redelivery policy for this connection.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Connection.IsStarted
member.summary: This property determines if the asynchronous message delivery of incoming messages has been started for this connection.

The StreamingContext that contains contextual information about the source or destination.

member.name: T:Apache.NMS.Stomp.MessageConsumer
member.summary: An object capable of receiving messages from some destination

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Stomp.MessageConsumer.Dequeue(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Used to get an enqueued message from the unconsumedMessages list. The amount of time this method blocks is based on the timeout value. if timeout == Timeout.Infinite then it blocks until a message is received. if timeout == 0 then it it tries to not block at all, it returns a message if it is available if timeout > 0 then it blocks up to timeout amount of time. Expired messages will consumed by this method.

member.name: T:Apache.NMS.Stomp.MessageProducer
member.summary: An object capable of sending messages to some destination

member.name: T:Apache.NMS.Stomp.PrefetchPolicy
member.summary: Class used to define the various limits that should be used for the Prefetch limit on destination based on the type of Destination in use.

member.name: T:Apache.NMS.Stomp.RequestTimedOutException
member.summary: Exception thrown when an Request times out.

member.name: T:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Session
member.summary: Default provider of ISession

member.name: F:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Session.myLock
member.summary: Private object used for synchronization, instead of public "this"

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Session.DeleteDestination(Apache.NMS.IDestination)
member.summary: Delete a destination (Queue, Topic, Temp Queue, Temp Topic).

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Session.DoStartTransaction
member.summary: Ensures that a transaction is started

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Session.DoNothingAcknowledge(Apache.NMS.Stomp.Commands.Message)
member.summary: Prevents message from throwing an exception if a client calls Acknoweldge on a message that is part of a transaction either being produced or consumed. The JMS Spec indicates that users should be able to call Acknowledge with no effect if the message is in a transaction.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Session.PrefetchSize
member.summary: Sets the prefetch size, the maximum number of messages a broker will dispatch to consumers until acknowledgements are received.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Session.MaximumPendingMessageLimit
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of messages to keep around per consumer in addition to the prefetch window for non-durable topics until messages will start to be evicted for slow consumers. Must be > 0 to enable this feature

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Session.DispatchAsync
member.summary: Enables or disables whether asynchronous dispatch should be used by the broker

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Session.Exclusive
member.summary: Enables or disables exclusive consumers when using queues. An exclusive consumer means only one instance of a consumer is allowed to process messages on a queue to preserve order

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Session.Retroactive
member.summary: Enables or disables retroactive mode for consumers; i.e. do they go back in time or not?

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.Stomp.Session.Priority
member.summary: Sets the default consumer priority for consumers

member.summary: Method AddSynchronization
